Package utilities

Class CopyPastAutonomous

java.lang.Object
utilities.CopyPastAutonomous
public class CopyPastAutonomous extends Object
A system for tracking robot position, and navigating to locations on the field.
Author:
Icarus Innovated

    Creates a new CopyPastAutonomous using two ConfigurablePID objects stored inside of an array

  • Constructor Details

    • CopyPastAutonomous

      public CopyPastAutonomous(ConfigurablePID[] PIDArray)
      Creates a new CopyPastAutonomous using two ConfigurablePID objects stored inside of an array
      Parameters:
      PIDArray - an array containing two ConfigurablePID objects, a heading PID and a speed PID

  • Method Details

    • updateRobotPositon

      public void updateRobotPositon(double leftMotorEncoderPos, double rightMotorEncoderPos, double yaw)
      Updates where the robot believes itself to be. This function should be called before any others, and also resets power levels as a safety.
      Parameters:
      leftMotorEncoderPos - The raw encoder value of the left side of the robot.
      rightMotorEncoderPos - The raw encoder value of the right side of the robot.
      yaw - The compass heading of the robot, in degrees, as measured by an IMU.

    • updateTargetHeadingAndSpeed

      public void updateTargetHeadingAndSpeed()
      Updates the internal target heading and target speed of the robot. The result is based on the currently set waypoint. Calling this function will also update the desired motor power levels.

    • getSteeringPower

      public double getSteeringPower()
      Gets the desired steering power of the robot, to reach the target waypoint, as of the last update.
      Returns:
      The power level, from -1 to 1, that the robot needs the steering to be set to.

    • getDrivePower

      public double getDrivePower()
      Gets the desired drive power of the robot, to reach the target waypoint, as of the last update.
      Returns:
      The power level, from -1 to 1, that the robot needs the drive to be set to.

    • setPosition

      public void setPosition(CartesianVector newPosition)
      Sets the robots current position to a new value, erasing any previous position tracking.
      Parameters:
      newPosition - A 2D vector object, containing the desired x and y values to set the position to.

    • getPosition

      public CartesianVector getPosition()
      Gets the currently tracked position of the robot. This is updated whenever updatePosition() or setPosition() are called.
      Returns:
      The tracked position of the robot. If updatePosition() has been running, this will reflect the robots position, in inches.

    • setReverse

      public void setReverse(boolean driveReverse)
      Sets the reverse setting of the robot. This value controls if the robot will go to waypoints while driving backwards or forwards.
      Parameters:
      driveReverse - A boolean for if the robot will drive in reverse. When true, it will drive backwards. When false, it will drive forwards.

    • setWaypoint

      public void setWaypoint(CartesianVector waypoint)
      Sets the robots current target, which is used by updateTargetHeadingAndSpeed().
      Parameters:
      waypoint - A 2D vector object, containing the desired x and y values to set the target waypoint to.

    • hasReachedWaypoint

      public boolean hasReachedWaypoint()
      A simple check for if the robot is within the configured MAX_WAYPOINT_ERROR of the currently set waypoint.
      Returns:
      True if the robot position is near the waypoint.

    • isAtPoint

      public boolean isAtPoint(CartesianVector point)
      A simple check for if the robot is within the configured MAX_WAYPOINT_ERROR of the input point.
      Parameters:
      point - A 2D vector containing the x and y values to check against.
      Returns:
      True if the robot position is near the input point.
